intro: Calyptranthes heineriana, commonly known as the Heiner's calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Calyptranthes heineriana is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
